member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information about an artist’s albums. Optional parameters can be specified in the parameters to filter the response.
member.param: Optional. A list of s that will be used to filter the response. If not supplied, all album types will be returned. Note multiple types can be selected like so: 'AlbumType.Album | AlbumType.AppearsOn'.
Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.
Optional. The maximum results to return, or -1 to retrieve all items.
Optional. The index of the first album to return. Default: 0 (i.e., the first album).

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Browse.IBrowseApi.GetFeaturedPlaylists(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a list of Spotify featured playlists (shown, for example, on a Spotify player’s ‘Browse’ tab).
member.param: Optional. The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639-1 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore. For example: es_MX, meaning “Spanish (Mexico)”. Provide this parameter if you want the results returned in a particular language (where available). Note that, if locale is not supplied, or if the specified language is not available, all strings will be returned in the Spotify default language (American English). The locale parameter, combined with the country parameter, may give odd results if not carefully matched. For example country=SE&locale=de_DE will return a list of categories relevant to Sweden but as German language strings.

Optional. A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country. If omitted, the returned items will be relevant to all countries.

Optional. Use this parameter to specify the user’s local time to get results tailored for that specific date and time in the day. If not provided, the response defaults to the current UTC time. Example: “2014-10-23T09:00:00” for a user whose local time is 9AM. If there were no featured playlists (or there is no data) at the specified time, the response will revert to the current UTC time.
Optional. The maximum results to return, or -1 to retrieve all items.
Optional. The index of the first item to return. Default: 0 (the first object). Use with limit to get the next set of items.
member.returns: A and a list of objects. The conveys a message like "Monday morning music, coming right up!".

member.summary: Get information about a user’s available devices.

member.summary: Get information about the user’s current playback state, including track, track progress, and active device.

member.summary: Get the object currently being played on the user’s Spotify account.
member.param: Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.TransferPlayback(System.Collections.Generic.List{SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Transfer playback to a new device and determine if it should start playing.
member.param: Required. A list containing the devices on which playback should be started/transferred. NOTE: Although an list is accepted, only a single is currently supported.
Optional. True: ensure playback happens on new device. False or not provided: keep the current playback state.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.StartPlayback(SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device,SpotifyWebApi.Model.Uri.SpotifyUri,System.Collections.Generic.List{SpotifyWebApi.Model.Uri.SpotifyUri})
member.summary: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user’s active device. TODO: Add offset parameter.
member.param: Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.
Optional. Spotify URI of the context to play. Valid contexts are albums, artists & playlists.
Optional. A list of the Spotify track URIs to play.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.PausePlayback(SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Pause playback on the user’s account.
member.param: Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.Next(SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Skips to next track in the user’s queue.
member.param: Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.Previous(SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Skips to previous track in the user’s queue. Note that this will ALWAYS skip to the previous track, regardless of the current track’s progress. Returning to the start of the current track should be performed using the function.
member.param: Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.Seek(System.Int32,SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Seeks to the given position in the user’s currently playing track.
member.param: The position in milliseconds to seek to. Must be a positive number. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song.
Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.SetRepeat(SpotifyWebApi.Model.Enum.RepeatState,SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Set the repeat mode for the user’s playback. Options are repeat-track, repeat-context, and off.
member.param: Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.SetVolume(System.Int32,SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Set the volume for the user’s current playback device.
member.param: The volume to set. Must be a value from 0 to 100 inclusive.
Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Player.IPlayerApi.SetShuffle(System.Boolean,SpotifyWebApi.Model.Device)
member.summary: Toggle shuffle on or off for user’s playback.
member.param: True: Shuffle user's playback. False: Do not shuffle user's playback
Optional. The device this command is targeting. If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.Playlist.IPlaylistApi.CreatePlaylist(SpotifyWebApi.Model.Uri.SpotifyUri,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Create a playlist for a Spotify user. See Remarks for and parameters.
member.param: The name for the new playlist, for example "Your Coolest Playlist". This name does not need to be unique; a user may have several playlists with the same name.
Optional. If true the playlist will be public, if false it will be private.
Optional. If true the playlist will be collaborative. Note that to create a collaborative playlist you must also set public to false.
Optional. Value for playlist description as displayed in Spotify Clients and in the Web API.
member.remarks: Note: that the playlist will be empty until you add tracks. Note: To be able to create private playlists, the user must have granted the scope. Note: To create collaborative playlists you must have granted and scopes.

member.name: M:SpotifyWebApi.Api.UserProfile.IUserProfileApi.GetMe
member.summary: Get detailed profile information about the current user (including the current user’s username).
member.returns: A object representing the current user.
member.remarks: A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service: see the Web API Authorization Guide for details. The access token must have been issued on behalf of the current user. Reading the user’s email address requires the scope; reading country and product subscription level requires the scope. Reading the user’s birthdate requires the scope.
